intro: Viscago nutans, commonly known as the hanging bladderwort, is a semi-aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, hairless stems that often trail over water surfaces or grow in moist soil. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically pale green or yellowish in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and may have a slight bluish tinge. Viscago nutans is known for its ability to trap small aquatic organisms, contributing to its role as a carnivorous plant.
